extendedIngredients.name: panko bread crumbs
extendedIngredients.originalString: Â½ cup panko crumbs (regular or gluten-free)

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Tater Tots

winePairing.pairingText: Southern works really well with Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. One wine you could try is Chateau Ste. Michelle Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 15 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling
productMatches.description: The Cold Creek Riesling is made from 40-year-old vines which contribute fruit intensity and concentration. This is a ripe, lush style of Riesling with aromas of ripe peaches, dried apricots and spice notes. It displays beautiful ripe fruit flavors with a crisp finish.

recipes.instructions: Heat your oven to 375F. Spray a cooking sheet with vegetable spray.Stab each sweet potato with a fork several times. Place in a microwave and cook for two minutes. The potatoes should be slightly tender at this point.Allow the sweet potatoes to cool, then chop them into large pieces.Place in a food processor along with the remaining ingredients except for the panko crumbs. Pulse for a few seconds until the ingredients are combined. We're going for a rough texture here, with lots of sweet potato pieces.Gather a handful (say a large tablespoon) of the mixture and roll into a tater tot form, roll in the bread crumbs, and place on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat until all the mixture is gone.Place the pan in the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, until the outside crust is golden. Remove from the oven. Serve warm.

steps.step: Heat your oven to 375F. Spray a cooking sheet with vegetable spray.Stab each sweet potato with a fork several times.
Place in a microwave and cook for two minutes. The potatoes should be slightly tender at this point.Allow the sweet potatoes to cool, then chop them into large pieces.

Place in a food processor along with the remaining ingredients except for the panko crumbs. Pulse for a few seconds until the ingredients are combined. We're going for a rough texture here, with lots of sweet potato pieces.Gather a handful (say a large tablespoon) of the mixture and roll into a tater tot form, roll in the bread crumbs, and place on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat until all the mixture is gone.
Place the pan in the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, until the outside crust is golden.
